Class Hand

java.lang.Object

All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable, java.util.Collection, java.util.List, java.util.Queue
 class Hand
extends Pile

Hand represents a hand of Cards in a card game Hand is a special type of Pile which can be tested as a winning hand in Gin Rummy

Author:
Ben Francis and Sam Black
See Also:
Pile

Field Summary
private  Card[] cards
          An array of Cards to hold the Hand when it is converted into an array for sorting
private  boolean[] checked
          An array which keeps track of which card values have been checked for potential books

PrintHand

public void PrintHand()
Prints the names of all the Cards in this hand in an ordered list

WinningHand

public boolean WinningHand()
Tests this Hand to determine whether it could be a winning hand in Gin Rummy. See documentation for algorithm design.

Returns:
true if a winning hand, false if not.
